p: Results of the biofilm formation on polystyrene showed that 44% of the isolates (22 isolates) were able to form biofilm with OD570 values ranging from 0.102 to 0.543 and were considered as low-grade positive. Biofilm development is estimated to be responsible for over 65% of nosocomial infections and 80% of all microbial infections [ 10], with urology being one of the main fields in which biofilm can become a serious problem [ 38]. Biofilms are considered as a virulence factor responsible for the long persistence of bacteria in the genitourinary tract [ 39]. According to Tabibian et al. [ 7], and Romling, and Balsalobre [ 10], biofilm markedly impedes the treatment of UTIs by protecting encased bacteria from both the host immune response and antimicrobial therapy. This can explain the prevalence and the persistence of E. coli UTIs in Saudi hospitals.
